result.execSummary:
The defendant Yoneth Santiago was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
SERVE 6 days with huber for work and treatment if defendant qualifies under jail classification system.  
IMPOSE and STAY 39 days as defendant is eligible for SSTOP program.
Any vehicle T&R in defendants name, as is defendant himself.  IID to be installed within 14 days.

Clerk Cheree
Cases 15CM3, 15CM442, 15FO4, 15TR71/72/73 called: 9:34am
State appears by ADA C.Minder.  Def appears in person and with Atty Gary Getzin. Interpreter Teresa Berger sworn and interprets for defendant.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  

State moves to:
15CM442 - Ct. 2>>DISMISSED
15CM3>>DISMISS entire file
15FO4>>DISMISS file
15TR71/72/73>>DISMISS each file
COURT GRANTS ABOVE

PLEA:
15CM442 - Ct. 1 (OWI 2nd)>>GUILTY

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.

COURT ORDERS: 45 days MCJ Total: 6 days to be served with 39 days I&S --CORRECTED 5/1/15 CLC--- as Defendant is eligible for SSTOP Program, w/huber for work and treatment if defendant qualifies under jail classification system, to begin within 45 days; $1379 inclusive; 14 month DL Rev w/credit; Any vehicles titled and registered in the defendant's name are ordered to have IID installed and IID is ordered on defendant himself, both for a period of 14 months; IID to be installed within 14 days; $50 IID surcharge to be paid; Defendant must be in full compliance with driver's safety plan, IID order and DL rev order; AODA (if not already deemed completed).

Adj: 9:50am
Pre-trial conference on April 2, 2015 at 09:05 am.
Shall not consume alcohol.  No driving WHATSOEVER.
